posts.title: 1. Hello World
posts.description: In this guide, we will examine the building blocks of React apps: elements and components. Once you master them, you can create complex apps from small reusable pieces.

posts.title: 2. Introducing JSX
posts.description: React embraces the fact that rendering logic is inherently coupled with other UI logic: how events are handled, how the state changes over time, and how the data is prepared for display.

posts.title: 3. Rendering Elements
posts.description: Unlike browser DOM elements, React elements are plain objects, and are cheap to create. React DOM takes care of updating the DOM to match the React elements.

posts.title: 4. Components and Props
posts.description: We will build a small game during this tutorial. You might be tempted to skip it because you’re not building games — but give it a chance. The techniques you’ll learn in the tutorial are fundamental to building any React app, and mastering it will give you a deep understanding of React.

posts.title: 5. State and Lifecycle
posts.description: This page introduces the concept of state and lifecycle in a React component. You can find a detailed component API reference here.

posts.title: Before We Start the Tutorial
posts.description: This page introduces the concept of state and lifecycle in a React component. You can find a detailed component API reference here.
